events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on April 30th, resulting in significant damage to the front bumper and hood of the vehicle.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured vehicle in a car collision.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the investigation and processing of the auto accident claim for the customer.
The insured party was promptly informed that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged and the processing has begun.
The claims department requested photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and a detailed incident description to proceed further.
The customer submitted all requested documents including the police report, multiple vehicle photos, and the accident description.
The claims agent began the investigation to verify the details of the car collision and assess the extent of the damage.
Investigation concluded confirming the accident was caused by the other party, and damage estimates for repairs were finalized.
A preliminary settlement offer was proposed to cover the repair costs for the vehicle as evaluated by the damage assessment.
The customer reviewed the settlement offer and provided feedback requesting clarification on the coverage of rental car expenses.
Due to concerns regarding rental car coverage, the claim was escalated to a senior claims adjuster for further review.
The claim was approved including coverage for vehicle repairs and rental car reimbursement as per policy terms.
Settlement payment was issued to the repair shop and rental car provider to cover the approved expenses promptly.
The auto accident claim was closed after confirming all payments were settled and the customer expressed satisfaction.
